summary: The "Restore Trust in Congress Act" aims to prevent members of Congress, their spouses, and dependents from owning or trading certain investments (covered investments) such as stocks, commodities, and futures. The bill defines "covered investments" and exempts certain holdings like US Treasury bills and diversified investment funds. It mandates divestiture within specific timeframes post-enactment and outlines penalties for violations. The bill also establishes provisions for certificates of divestiture, occupational exceptions, and addresses investments held in trusts or acquired through special circumstances. Supervising ethics offices will issue interpretative guidance. Penalties include fees and disgorgement of profits. The bill emphasizes transparency by requiring publication of fines and their rationale.
